DOC.brief_summary: intrauterine device insertion requires use a vulsellum to stabilize the cervix. Patient's often complain that its placement is one of the most uncomfortable parts of this procedure
DOC.brief_title: Fast Versus Slow Application of Vulsellum During Intrauterine Device Insertion
DOC.criteria: 1. Women not taken analgesics or anxiolytics in the 24 hours prior insertion 2. Women not taken misoprostol prior to IUD insertion 3. No contraindication to or history of allergic reaction to lidocaine 4. Women who will accept to participate in the study Any contraindication to IUD placement
